titlestmt.titleproper: Henry Phillips Jr. letter to Joel Munsell, 1863 November 10
titlestmt.author: David Hill

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by David Hill using EADitor ©2011

change.item: Imported into EADitor. Some normalization has occurred to apply EAD 2002 schema validation and conform to EADitor basic requirements.

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Henry Phillips Jr. letter to Joel Munsell
did.abstract: Letter from Henry Phillips Jr. of Philadelphia to Joel Munsell of Albany regarding paper money.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Henry Phillips Jr. of Philadelphia was a philologist and numismatist who served as curator, secretary, and librarian of the American Philosophical Society and secretary and treasurer of the Numismatic and Antiquarian Society of Philadelphia.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: One letter, dated November 10, 1863, from Henry Phillips Jr. of Philadelphia to Joel Munsell of Albany in which Phillips requests that Munsell consider publishing his work on Pennsylvania paper money, along with several other works that together would "contain all that has hitherto appeared on the subject of Colonial and Continental paper money."

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Henry Phillips Jr. letter to Joel Munsell, 1863 November 10, Archives, American Numismatic Society.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: Copyright restrictions may apply. Permission to publish or reproduce must be secured from the American Numismatic Society.
